channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: HSBC exec says there's a lot of AI 'success theater' happening in finance
item.description: Some financial services firms are making bold statements about AI but not seeing tangible results, according to HSBC's head of generative AI.

item.title: China's property stimulus raises optimism — but more steps are needed for a sectoral turnaround
item.description: Home sales during the Golden Week holiday — which is traditionally a peak period for big-ticket spendings — have been on a multi-year decline since 2021.

item.title: Mining giant Rio Tinto to acquire Arcadium Lithium in $6.7 billion deal
item.description: The world's second-largest miner Rio Tinto said Wednesday it will acquire U.S. lithium producer Arcadium for $6.7 billion.

item.title: Left and right prey on weak French government as it prepares 'austerity' budget
item.description: France's new and already beleaguered government is to present its 2025 budget Thursday amid an ongoing fiscal crisis for the euro zone's second-largest economy.

item.title: DOJ indicates it’s considering Google breakup following monopoly ruling
item.description: The Department of Justice late Tuesday indicated that it was considering a possible breakup of Google as an antitrust remedy.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Opportunity in October’s choppiness for stocks
item.description: The see-saw motion of stocks in October isn’t all that bad if investors can seize the right time to enter the market or solidify their positions further.

item.title: China's Golden Week holiday signals persistent consumer caution
item.description: China's Golden Week holiday affirmed a trend in more cautious spending, while consumers put greater emphasis on experiences.

item.title: This 42-year-old built a $2 billion a year super app called Grab: I worked '20 hour' days
item.description: Anthony Tan, 42, is the co-founder and CEO of Grab. As of 2023, the company serves 35 million customers and provides 13 million gig jobs across Southeast Asia.

item.title: ‘She doesn't stop talking’: How extroverts unknowingly irritate fellow travelers
item.description: Hours of chatting. Jam-packed vacation days. The same activities that extroverts thrive on can overwhelm their introverted travel companions.

item.title: Baidu's robotaxi unit is exploring expansion into global markets in the 'near future'
item.description: Chinese tech company Baidu's robotaxi unit Apollo Go is in talks to expand overseas in the near future, according to a source familiar with the situation.

item.title: New Zealand central bank slashes rates by 50 basis points in second straight rate cut
item.description: The RBNZ slashed rates from 5.25% to 4.75% on Wednesday, marking its second straight cut to its interest rate since August.

item.title: Boeing withdraws contract offer after talks with union end without a deal
item.description: The breakdown extends a machinist strike at Boeing that has halted production of most of the company's aircraft.

item.title: China's growth is set to slow next year despite temporary boost from stimulus, World Bank warns
item.description: China's economic growth rate is expected to decline further in 2025 despite a temporary boost from a raft of recent stimulus measures, the World Bank says.

item.title: Russia is on a 'sustained mission' to create mayhem on Europe's streets, UK spy chief says
item.description: The head of Britain's domestic spy agency accused Russian military intelligence of being on a "sustained mission to generate mayhem."

item.title: S&P's Dan Yergin warns of 'dangerous time' for global economy as Middle East tensions fester
item.description: The global economy is staring at a "dangerous time" like never before as Middle East tensions remain elevated, said S&P Global's vice chairman Daniel Yergin.

item.title: States sue TikTok over app's effects on kids' mental health
item.description: More than half of American teens ages 13 to 17 use TikTok, the short-form video social media app owned by ByteDance, a Chinese company.

item.title: Crude oil futures sell off after surging on Middle East war risk
item.description: Geopolitical risk remains high, but Israel has not yet retaliated against Iran.

item.title: Apple could launch a ring to rival Samsung by 2026, research firm predicts
item.description: Apple could launch a connected ring to rival Samsung by 2026, according to CCS Insight, adding to the U.S. tech giant's focus on health.

item.title: Brazil lifts ban on X after Elon Musk complies with court orders
item.description: Following a months-long standoff with the country's supreme court, X is coming back online in Brazil.

item.title: Harris is borrowing from 'Republican playbook' as she leads Trump in new national poll
item.description: Pollster Frank Luntz cited a new poll showing Kamala Harris leading Donald Trump for the first time since Joe Biden dropped out of the presidential race.

item.title: Why oil and gas markets are dreading the risk of supply disruption in the Strait of Hormuz
item.description: An escalating conflict in the Middle East has thrust the world's most important oil artery back into the global spotlight.

item.title: Trump Media stock soars nearly 19% as DJT extends longest rally since June
item.description: Trump Media, majority-owned by Republican nominee Donald Trump, operates the Truth Social platform and trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.

item.title: GM expects 2025 earnings to be similar to this year's despite industry headwinds
item.description: The Detroit automaker's targeted adjusted earnings before interest and taxes this year is between $13 billion and $15 billion, or $9.50 and $10.50 per share.

item.title: Jim Cramer looks at Amazon and Apple and why it can be tough to sit on good stocks
item.description: Cramer recapped action in the stocks of Apple and Amazon, which received downgrades on Monday — ratings with which he disagreed. Both recovered by Tuesday.

item.title: Harris seeks to convert economic tailwinds into votes as election enters homestretch
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris enters the final month of the presidential election with a surprisingly strong jobs report and booming stock market behind her.

item.title: BetMGM wagers that new technology, football can lead to a resurgence
item.description: BetMGM is trying to regain lost ground in both sports gambling and online casino games.

item.title: Uber gives users option to only hail full-electric cars, launches AI chatbot for EV-curious drivers
item.description: Uber announced a spate of fresh measures to update its sustainability features globally, including an "EV preference" for ride-hailers.

item.title: Boeing delivers 33 jets in September but strike impact looms
item.description: Boeing delivered 33 jets but overall deliveries are down on the year.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's PIF cuts stake in Nintendo after report said it was considering increase
item.description: The PIF reduced its stakehold in the Japanese video game giant to 7.54% from 8.58% previously, according to a Japanese regulatory filing.

item.title: Samsung posts disappointing third-quarter profit guidance as it grapples with AI chips
item.description: Samsung posts worse-than-expected guidance for third quarter
